Line 208: Line 208:
[[Image:Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha 1.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha 1<br /> (''Intrepid Ibex'')]]
[[Image:Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha 1.png|right|thumb|Ubuntu 8.10 Alpha 1<br /> (''Intrepid Ibex'')]]
â
Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu Linux.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a complete desktop redesign,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, [[OpenGL]] face browser for [[GNOME Display Manager|GDM]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://arstechnica.com/journals/linux.ars/2008/04/29/ubuntus-opengl-face-browser-will-bring-bling-to-gdm | title=Ubuntu GDM update|accessdate=2008-04-29}}</ref>, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator and an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxloop.com/news/2008/07/03/top-5-new-features-of-ubuntu-810-interpid-ibex/ | title=Linux Loop:Top 5 New Features of Ubuntu 8.10 Intrepid Ibex |accessdate=2008-07-08}}</ref>
+
Ubuntu 8.10 (''Intrepid Ibex''), to be released on [[2008-10-30]],<ref name="intrepid_release">{{cite web |url=https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+milestone/ubuntu-8.10|title=Milestone ubuntu-8.10 for Ubuntu due 2008-10-30|accessdate=2008-04-28}}</ref> will be Canonical's ninth release of Ubuntu.<ref name="warty_release" /> It will be supported until April 2010. Ubuntu 8.10 has several planned new features including a complete desktop redesign,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-art/2008-January/004855.html | title=Ubuntu theme update postponed | accessdate=2008-03-26}}</ref> improvements to mobile computing and desktop scalability, increased flexibility for Internet connectivity, [[OpenGL]] face browser for [[GNOME Display Manager|GDM]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://arstechnica.com/journals/linux.ars/2008/04/29/ubuntus-opengl-face-browser-will-bring-bling-to-gdm | title=Ubuntu GDM update|accessdate=2008-04-29}}</ref>, a [[Graphical User Interface|GUI]] driven [[Live USB]] creator and an encrypted 'private' directory in each user's home directory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxloop.com/news/2008/07/03/top-5-new-features-of-ubuntu-810-interpid-ibex/ | title=Linux Loop:Top 5 New Features of Ubuntu 8.10 Intrepid Ibex |accessdate=2008-07-08}}</ref>
